page.title: 10ECOLOGY AND CONSERVATION
page.content: THE MILD CLIMATE IN THIS AREA MAKES IT IDEAL FOR MANY WILD FLOWER SPECIES TO SURVIVE. THE PRESENTLY ENDANGERED CORNFLOWER MAY STILL BE FOUND ON SOME LOCAL SITES AS ITS RURAL LOCATION LEAVES IT RELATIVELY UNDISTURBED. CIRCULAR SPINNEYS - CULTIVATED BY EARL SPENCER, A LOCAL LANDOWNER, EXIST ON MOST HILLTOPS IN THE VICINITY. THESE ARE INHABITED BY A COLLECTION OF PIGEONS, GREY SQUIRRELS, MICE, RATS AND THE INEVITABLE PHEASANT FAMILIES. THE RABBIT POPULATION ALSO SEEMS TO BE INCREASING IN RECENT YEARS AND MAY POSSIBLY PROVIDE A THREAT TO FARMERS IN THE FUTURE, AS IN THE YEARS BEFORE MIXIMATOSIS WAS INTRODUCED AS A MEANS OF CONTROL. THERE IS LITTLE OR NO POLLUTION LOCALLY AND THE NUMEROUS FOOTPATHS PROVIDE MANY PLEASURABLE SIGHTS FOR THE WALKER AND PONY RIDER ALIKE.
